title: Tuareg people
summary: The Tuareg people (/ˈtwɑːrɛɡ/; also spelt Twareg or Touareg; endonym: Imuhaɣ/Imušaɣ/Imašeɣăn/Imajeɣăn[6]) are a large Berber ethnic group that principally inhabit the Sahara in a vast area stretching from far southwestern Libya to southern Algeria, Niger, Mali and Burkina Faso.[7] Traditionally nomadic pastoralists, small groups of Tuareg are also found in northern Nigeria.[8]
